page.title: 13MENDLESHAM SCHOOL TODAY
page.content: Mendlesham school is a very little school. It is a victorian building made out of bricks and has a slate roof. There are four classrooms but there are three teachers and three classes. There is no hall so we use the spare classroom for assembly, music, television and things like that. Around the school there is a playground with a climbing frame. In the summer the swimming pool is put up in the playground. There is a path which leads to our playing field and canteen. The canteen is separate from the school and dinners are cooked there. We sometimes use the canteen for dancing or PE or games if its wet. Our school is on the edge of the village. Children start when they are nearly five and leave to go to the middle school when they are nine.
